name: Hotel Lippert

reviews.text: Our friends found this place and we were all very happy with it. They advertise as being the only hotel directly on the Old Town Square. You can’t get a better location, especially when it’s directly across from the Tyn Church enabling you to take pictures of it in all light conditions directly from your window. Both of our double rooms had windows directly onto the square and, being over each other, had identical foot prints. Nice large bedroom with a couple of chairs and desk, reasonable closet space in an armoire and an acceptably sized bathroom with enclosed shower.
reviews.title: Cerna Liska--a foxy hotel on Prague's Old Town Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel entry is small but has an internet corner and free access. The restaurant where buffet breakfast is served is directly across the hall from the hotel desk. Breakfast was included in the price of the room (180 euros, hotels are not cheap in Prague) and it was excellent. Besides a buffet of all the standard offerings, including scrambled eggs and sausages and one day including head cheese among the sliced meats, they always had some interesting, different generally vegetarian offering—one day a breakfast paella, another day quiche, etc. The restaurant seemed cute and friendly though it was a little too much on the vegetarian/healthy side to attract me to take a meal other than breakfast there.
reviews.title: Unbeatable Location and Great Hotel

reviews.text: Service was, well, serviceable. They called cabs for us, got us a wake up call as requested, etc. They didn’t seem particularly friendly at the front desk but that isn’t to say that they were unfriendly, just serviceable.
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Prague!
Don't hesitate with this one - book it!
reviews.text: We were well satisfied with our rooms, the breakfast and loved the view and location and would definitely stay there again. We preferred it to the residence hotel we had at the Seven Angels just off the Old Town Square on a previous trip and while the Relais and Chateau Hoffmeister in Mala Strana where we also stayed before was a superior hotel, for location and value it was also not the equal of the Cerna Liska.
My boyfriend and I have visited Prague before and this time wanted to stay closer to the Old Town Square - Hotel Cerna Liska was the perfect location and cant be faulted.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel in Old Town Square. We stayed in room 303, the best in the house, top floor overlooking the square (ask for it when you book). The staff are superb and the rooms spotless.
reviews.title: Can't be beaten

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I only stayed one night in Prague. I choose this hotel for the price & location and from reviews from this site and other sources and I have to say I was very happy with my choice.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was fantastic - with a brilliant view of the Old Town Square. As with other reviews, it was a little noisy but to be expected. The air-conditioner drowned out all the noise and we had a brilliant sleep. The room was superb and very clean. Absolutely no complaints.
reviews.title: Great Location and Friendly Staff

reviews.text: The 24hr reception was very handy. My boyfriend went out at 4:30am to take photos around Prague at sunrise for an hr or two and the poor fellow at reception was there to let him in and out.
reviews.title: Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't get down to Breakfast till 10am and it finished 10:30. The hot food had gone, so I can't really comment but what was left was perfectly adequate.
reviews.title: Everything about it was great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mainly booked due to its proximity to the old town only to find that it is not close to the old town, it is in old town. We probably have had one of the best rooms with a view in Central Europe. See the photos for the view by the way.
reviews.title: Super Location, Cleanness, Quality... Time Tunnel with a Style.

reviews.text: The hotel is quite old yet its age is visible from the architectural style only.
reviews.title: Fabulous location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was very, very, but very clean with no traces of paint overs, stains, cracks whatsoever. It had one of the cleanest bathroom I have seen in an hotel of this price range.
reviews.title: Great location for first visit to Prague

likes.disliked: — Firm beds and smoking during breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a landmark. Do not expect to find extra facilities as a bar, pool, or a large lounge. As soon as you walk into the hotel, you will face the front desk, Paul was the individual who helped us. He was very courteous and professional. Hotel does not use room cards. You need to check your key in and out on the way. Very cool.
reviews.title: Wow the best hotel in Prague - Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In side the hotel, there is a restaurant we only had the breakfast at. The breakfast was awesome with fresh juice, cold cuts variety of cheese, fresh fruit, salad and good coffee, and a super bread selection.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Cerna Liska
A GREAT little place to stay!
reviews.text: A friend and I just returned from Prague and our accomodations at Hotel Cerna Liska were absolutely wonderful. After staying the week before in the Hilton in Budapest we wondered how much "roughing it" we had in store for Prague. We were delightfully surprised. It was right in the middle of everything! Literally. The staff was more than helpful and the rooms were immaculent. I am already planning a trip there in a few months and this is will be my hotel of choice!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic! The location could not be better. We knew ahead of time from reading reviews that the location was amazing but WOW. The staff was amazingly nice and very helpful and happy to speak english. Bonus was breakfast was included and the food and staff were great.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room one floor above ground level on the corner with three windows facing the square. What a great room. It was by far the largest room we stayed in on our trip in Europe. It was beautifully decorated, murals on the ceiling, a fabulous bathroom and very quiet. Despite the hotel being full and prime tourist season the room was as quite as could be.
reviews.title: unbelievable hotel and location

likes.liked: — location, service, room size and ammenities
likes.disliked: — a/c did not cool that well, but they provided a fan and it was just fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't wait to go back to Prague and I will definately stay here.
reviews.title: Cerna liska is awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a tip, the Gyros Grill right next door tried to rip me off each time I went there, giving me the wrong change. Most people probably don't notice as some of the coins look the same. This place has nothing to do with the Hotel just happens to be next to it.
reviews.title: absolutely loved this place

likes.liked: — The view, and Hospitality and the most comfortable beds ever..

description: Small comfortable family hotel with friendly and attentive staff excellently located directly at the Old Town Square.
